text: Citizens can register their complaints with police and then based on the evidence, facts and following investigation, police shall take the complaint forward.
The Search module of the CCTNS gives police personnel the ability to execute a basic or advanced search on cases.
Citizens can use it as a tool to get information or acknowledgements from police.
The solution should send alerts (e.g., email, SMS) to the user if the user chooses to whenever any action has been taken on the alert.
An audit trail is a record of actions taken by either the user or the system triggers.
The System must be able to export audit trails for specified cases (without affecting the audit trail stored by the System).
The System must allow the user to limit access to cases to specified users or user groups.
The System must allow changes to security attributes for groups or users (such as access rights, security level, privileges, password allocation and management) to be made only by super-user.
The System must employ a single set of user interface rules, or a small number of sets to provide a familiar and common look and feel for the application.

Originator also known as requisitioner, has the original demand for each Item of goods and/or services.
Quotation is sent by the Sales Point (Seller) to Originator (Buyer) to inform the Buyer of the terms and conditions under which the Seller is willing or able to supply goods or services.

County Court Judge, Person elected and/or appointed to preside over a trial court with misdemeanor criminal jurisdiction.
District Court Judge, Person elected and/or appointed to preside over a trial court with felony criminal jurisdiction.
Presiding Administrative Judge, Person appointed by the Governor to preside over the administrative judicial region.
An instant messenger is an application, which allows instant text communication between two or more people through a network such as the Internet.

The system will allow analysts to enter a new goal into the system as new goals are identified.
The system will allow analysts and guests to choose a policy and then the system will allow analysts and guests to view the the number of different goals that occur in that policy.
The system shall allow analysts to graphically view the allowable flows for specific types within an organization and across multiple organizations given a set of access control policies.
The Clarus system shall be able to access remotely sensed environmental observations from data collectors.
The Clarus system shall accept surface condition data derived from surface images.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data acquisition.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from (roadway) vehicles.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive weather data from weather service providers.
The Clarus system shall not modify original observations.
The Clarus system shall be able to implement quality control rules for specific environmental situations.
The Clarus system shall be able to detect data submission errors.
The Clarus program shall alert users to system modifications.
The Clarus system shall log data transactions.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate hydrologic data.
The Clarus system shall accept only observations of known measurement types and units.
The Clarus system shall be able to communicate with RWIS databases through their native interfaces.
The Clarus system shall allow service providers to select specific desired data sets.
The Clarus system shall enable environmental data queries by source.
The Clarus system shall use hardware that implements industry accepted standard interfaces.
The Clarus system shall disseminate data in response to a change notification request.
The Clarus system shall support 470 million current observations.
The Clarus system shall respond to a request for information within one minute.
The Clarus program shall establish data sharing agreements with all participating sources of environmental data.
The Clarus program shall provide setup support.
The Clarus program shall define data retention standards.

The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from the Chrysler Fast Feedback (telematics demonstration) fleet using the Chrysler telematics interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Detroit Department of Transportation (DDOT) Transit using the DDOT interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect weather data from the Road Commission for Oakland County (RCOC) Road Weather Information Systems (RWIS) using the RCOC RWIS interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect Origin/Destination (O/D) data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from the Road Commission of Macomb County (RCMC) system using the RCMC system interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect road condition data.
The DUAP System shall cache (both raw and derived) probe vehicle data.
The DUAP Computational Services shall be able to derive congestion level based on volume to capacity from probe vehicle data.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new computational algorithms.
The System shall provide the capability to notify customers upon the NPOESS Ground System entering and leaving a Degraded Operations Mode.
The System shall provide the capability to control the execution of Scientific Algorithms.
The System shall be capable of rendering Polar Stereographic projections.

Mediator generates service requirements as the basis for negotiated relationships.
In the face of traffic surges, Service Registry supplies any necessary local resource information to the mediator.
Peering Agent exchanges policy, resource information, and service requirements with external Peering Agent.
Each CDN Web server publishes resource and service information.
If the user requests can not be accepted according the provider policies, service requirements are not passed to the local Peering Agent.
Local Peering Agent receives service requirements from the mediator.
Once policies are negotiated and a peering arrangement is established, Peering Agent interact each other in the execution of common goal(s).
If any of the termination condition holds, the local Peering Agent disbands or re-arranges the peering arrangement.

Receiving Associate: A member of the Construction Junction staff who receives donated items at the receiving docks and performs their initial entry into the Inventory Management System and provides donors with their donation receipts.

Construction Junction Staff Member: Any of the Construction Junction user types: Administrator, Director, Manager, Receiving Associate, Pickup Associate, Decon Associate, Customer Service Representative or Sales Associate.
Consigner: An individual who donates items to Construction Junction under consignment.

The ELSS must permit the Master of the vessel to generate formatted data for transmission to the UK fisheries administrations’ ERS system.

ELSS must only be supplied for use at sea and loaded onto an onboard system and is not to be provided for onshore use by agents or representatives.
